name: puppeteer_advanced_features
description: Emulation, device profiles, geolocation, timezone, and performance monitoring

args: const puppeteer = require('puppeteer'); const devices = puppeteer.devices; (async () => { const browser = await puppeteer.launch(); const page = await browser.newPage(); await page.emulate(devices['iPhone 12']); await page.goto('https://example.com'); const userAgent = await page.evaluate(() => navigator.userAgent); console.log('User Agent:', userAgent); await browser.close(); })();

expected_output.example:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; CPU iPhone OS 14_4 like Mac OS X)...

iPhone device emulated

args: const puppeteer = require('puppeteer'); (async () => { const browser = await puppeteer.launch(); const page = await browser.newPage(); await page.setGeolocation({latitude: 40.7128, longitude: -74.0060}); const context = browser.defaultBrowserContext(); await context.overridePermissions('https://example.com', ['geolocation']); console.log('Geolocation set to New York'); await browser.close(); })();

expected_output.example:
Geolocation set to New York

Location spoofed to specific coordinates

args: const puppeteer = require('puppeteer'); (async () => { const browser = await puppeteer.launch(); const page = await browser.newPage(); await page.goto('https://example.com'); const metrics = await page.metrics(); console.log('Performance:'); console.log('  JSHeapUsedSize:', (metrics.JSHeapUsedSize / 1048576).toFixed(2), 'MB'); console.log('  Nodes:', metrics.Nodes); console.log('  LayoutCount:', metrics.LayoutCount); await browser.close(); })();

expected_output.example:
Performance:
  JSHeapUsedSize: 12.34 MB
  Nodes: 42
  LayoutCount: 3

Page performance metrics collected
